metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4232 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the t2p_readwrite_pdf_image function in tools/tiff2pdf.c in libtiff 4.0.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted TIFF image.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4232` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-5ubuntu1
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-5ubuntu1
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-5ubuntu1
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-5ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> tiff3 does not build the tiff tools

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-5ubuntu1').
